definition: to compete/competition/match/to surpass/better than/superior to/to excel

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: Most of the competitors were knocked out of the competition.
sentences.chinese: 大多数竞赛者从竞赛中被淘汰出去了。

sentences.english: The racer lapped in 1 minute 43 seconds.
sentences.chinese: 竞赛者用了1分43秒跑完了一圈。

sentences.english: The prize will depend on the number of contestants.
sentences.chinese: 拿奖金将取决于竞赛者的数量。

sentences.english: The long tournament brought many competitors to their knees.
sentences.chinese: 长程的赛事让许多竞赛者都撑不下去。

sentences.english: The company doesn't need to keep inventory! unlike its competitors in online rettroubled.
sentences.chinese: 不像其它线上批发业的竞赛者，该公司不必要有库存。

sentences.english: The hostess promised to give each contestant, a fair show in answering the questions.
sentences.chinese: 主持人答应在回答问题时给每位竞赛者以公平的机会。

sentences.english: The competitors were prostrated by the heat.
sentences.chinese: 竞赛者们由于天气炎热而力不从心。

definition: keirin cycle race (paced stadium event) (loanword from Japanese 競輪 "keirin"
sporting event/item on program of sports competition

pinyin: Ao4 lin2 pi3 ke4 Yun4 dong4 hui4

definition: time trial (e.g. in cycle race)/timed race/competition against the clock
